intro: Psychotria brandneriana subsp. brandneriana, commonly known as the "Cape Cod psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the eastern United States, particularly found in the coastal regions of North Carolina and South Carolina. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in dune environments. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
